summary: Recipients of the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program, formerly known as food stamps, have reported more than $320 million in stolen benefits. Most SNAP cards lack theft-prevention features, like microchips, that are standard on commercial debit cards. This Q&A looks at efforts to help prevent benefit theft, such as allowing recipients to lock their cards, which can prevent unauthorized transactions. But the U.S. Department of Agriculture...
title: Nutrition Assistance: USDA Should Comprehensively Assess Benefit Theft Prevention Measures States Are Implementing
